intro: [WRONG START] Pleurotholis unguiculata, commonly known as the clawed pleurothallis, is a species of orchid native to the tropical regions of South America. It is a small, epiphytic plant that typically grows on trees in humid, shaded environments. The plant features delicate, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, fragrant flowers in shades of white and pale yellow. Its flowers are often clustered in racemes and bloom during the rainy season. Due to its unique appearance and habitat, it is a subject of interest for botanists and orchid enthusiasts alike.
